Detailed Description

ExportDialog class is the dialog to define the photon map export mode.

ExportDialog sets the photons to export, the coordinates system and the file to save selected information.

Definition at line 52 of file ExportDialog.h.

Constructor & Destructor Documentation

ExportDialog::ExportDialog ( SceneModel &  sceneModel,
QString  previousSurfaceUrl = 0,
bool  previusInGlobal = true,
QString  previousFile = 0,
QWidget *  parent = 0 
)

Creates a dialog to define export parameters. The dialog need sceneModel to allow user to select a surface to export. Sets export mode to export all photos if previousSurfaceUrl is empty. Otherwise, sets to surface export mode. Sets global coordinate system if previusInGlobal is true. Otherwise, sets to local coordinate system. The current export file value takes the previousFile name. The file previousFile is the last file uses to export a photon map.

QString ExportDialog::GetExportFileName ( ) const

Returns id to indicate selected photon map photons.

If all photon map is selected, returns 0. To surface photon map returns 1.

See also:

QString ExportDialog::GetSelectedSurface ( ) const

Return selected surface node url.

Returns an empty string if there is not selection or selected node is not surface node.

void ExportDialog::SetExportAllPhotons ( bool  allPhotos) [private, slot]
